Segera Punya Bos Baru, Begini Riwayat Kinerja Bank Mandiri
02 Nov 2019, 07:55 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kementerian Badan Usaha Milik Negara dalam waktu dekat akan menunjuk direktur utama untuk PT Bank Mandiri Persero Tbk menggantikan Kartika Wirjoatmodjo yang kini menjadi Wakil Menteri BUMN. Menteri BUMN Erick Thohir pada Rabu lalu, 31 Oktober 2019, menyatakan telah mengantongi nama Direktur Utama Bank Mandiri atau BMRI.
"Yang pasti bekas lulusan atau masih orang Bank Mandiri," kata Erick di Jakarta, Rabu lalu. Tanpa menggamblangkan nama kandidat tersebut, Erick memastikan pengumuman penunjukan dirut bank pelat merah akan dilakukan dalam waktu dekat.
Sumber Tempo di Kementerian BUMN menyatakan kandidat kuat Direktur Utama Bank Mandiri adalah Royke Tumilaar. Saat ini, Royke masih menjabat sebagai Direktur Corporate Banking.
Sinyal pemilihan kandidat ini diperkuat dengan pernyataan Kartika--mantan Dirut Bank Mandiri yang saat ini menjabat sebagai Wakil Menteri BUMN. Kartika berharap Dirut Utama Bank Mandiri bakal berasal dari kalangan internal atau organik."Tentunya kita harapkan teman-teman dari dalam menjadi pilihan yang lebih diutamakan," katanya.
Nah, bagaimana riwayat kinerja Bank Mandiri beberapa tahun terakhir?
Catatan Tempo, Bank pelat merah Mandiri tahun ini mengalami perlambatan pertumbuhan. Berdasarkan laporan triwulanan, Bank Mandiri mencatatkan pertumbuhan laba bersih 12 persen senilai Rp 20,3 triliun pada triwulan III. Meski masih tumbuh dobel digit, angka ini masih lebih rendah ketimbang periode yang sama pada tahun lalu dengan pertumbuhan mencapai 20 persen.

Soon Got a New Boss, Here's the Performance History of Bank Mandiri
02 Nov 2019, 07:55 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises in the near future will appoint a managing director for PT Bank Mandiri Persero Tbk replacing Kartika Wirjoatmodjo who is now the Deputy Minister of BUMN. SOE Minister Erick Thohir said on Wednesday, October 31, 2019, that he had pocketed the name of the President Director of Bank Mandiri or BMRI.
"What is certain is that they are former graduates or are still Bank Mandiri people," Erick said in Jakarta last Wednesday. Without describing the name of the candidate, Erick ensured that the announcement of the appointment of the president of the state-owned bank will be made in the near future.
A Tempo source at the BUMN Ministry said that the strong candidate for President Director of Bank Mandiri was Royke Tumilaar. Currently, Royke still serves as Director of Corporate Banking.
This candidate selection signal is strengthened by the statement of Kartika - former President Director of Bank Mandiri who currently serves as Deputy Minister of BUMN. Kartika hopes that Bank Mandiri's Managing Director will come from internal or organic circles. "Of course we hope our friends from within will be the preferred choice," he said.
Well, what is the history of Bank Mandiri's recent performance?
Tempo notes, Bank Mandiri's Mandiri state-owned bank this year experienced a slowdown in growth. Based on quarterly reports, Bank Mandiri recorded a net profit growth of 12 percent, valued at Rp 20.3 trillion in the third quarter. Although it is still growing double digits, this figure is still lower than the same period last year with growth reaching 20 percent.
